visa.title: About Student Visa Status
visa.description: Students residing overseas who apply for the 1.5-year or 2-year academic course need to apply for a 'Student' visa (mid to long-term residence status). The 1.5-year course starts in October, while the 2-year course starts in April each year. We recommend preparing application materials six months in advance.

residents.title: For Residents in Japan
residents.description: Those who do not need to apply for a new 'Student' visa include those who already hold a 'Student' visa in Japan or those who hold other residence statuses in Japan (e.g., Business Manager, Dependent, or other residence statuses). For enrollment periods and inquiries, you can contact the school at any time.

dragonboat.description1: Itoman City, where our school is located, has a long history with China and hosts the annual Itoman Haarii (Dragon Boat Race) similar to those in China. We strive to enable students to actively participate in this traditional event. We consider this activity an important part of our educational program aimed at preserving traditional culture and fostering teamwork spirit and sportsmanship among students.
dragonboat.description2: Itoman Haarii is not just a sporting event, but a cultural heritage and a symbol of friendship. Through this activity, our school hopes that students will experience the local culture.

intro.title: Course Introduction
intro.description: Our school offers academic preparation courses for Japanese vocational schools, universities, and graduate schools, as well as private lessons. Private lessons can be freely adjusted according to student needs.
